description: Build a comprehensive multi-tenant e-commerce platform with merchant management, payment processing, inventory systems, and extensible app marketplace - following Shopify's proven architecture.

frontend.rationale: Shopify uses React-based architecture for both admin and storefront. Next.js provides excellent SEO for merchant stores.

backend.rationale: Shopify pioneered GraphQL for e-commerce APIs. Node.js provides excellent performance for high-traffic stores.

database.rationale: PostgreSQL for transactional data, Redis for sessions/cart, Elasticsearch for product search and analytics.

payments.rationale: Multiple payment processors for global coverage and redundancy. Stripe for primary processing with fallbacks.

storage.rationale: Scalable file storage for product images, themes, and merchant uploads with global distribution.

infrastructure.rationale: Container orchestration for multi-tenant scaling. Auto-scaling for traffic spikes during sales events.

questions.text: What type of e-commerce model will you build?

choices.label: SaaS platform (merchants pay monthly, like Shopify)
choices.impact: Multi-tenant architecture, subscription billing, merchant onboarding

choices.label: Marketplace (sellers and buyers, like Etsy)
choices.impact: Commission-based revenue, seller verification, dispute resolution

choices.label: White-label solution (license to other companies)
choices.impact: Enterprise features, custom branding, dedicated instances

choices.label: Single store platform (own inventory)
choices.impact: Simpler architecture, inventory management, direct fulfillment

questions.impact: Determines multi-tenancy requirements, billing model, and platform complexity

questions.text: How complex are your payment requirements?

choices.label: Basic payments (credit cards, PayPal)
choices.impact: Single payment processor, standard checkout flow

choices.label: Global payments (multiple currencies, local methods)
choices.impact: Multi-processor setup, currency conversion, regional compliance

choices.label: Marketplace payments (split payments, escrow)
choices.impact: Complex payment flows, seller payouts, dispute handling

choices.label: Subscription + one-time payments
choices.impact: Recurring billing, prorated charges, subscription management

questions.impact: Affects payment processor choice, checkout complexity, and compliance requirements

questions.text: What level of inventory management do you need?

choices.label: Basic inventory (stock levels, simple tracking)
choices.impact: Simple stock counters, low stock alerts

choices.label: Advanced inventory (variants, bundles, reservations)
choices.impact: Complex product variants, inventory reservations, bundle management

choices.label: Multi-location inventory (warehouses, stores)
choices.impact: Location-based inventory, transfer management, fulfillment routing

choices.label: Dropshipping integration (supplier management)
choices.impact: Supplier APIs, automated ordering, inventory sync

questions.impact: Determines inventory data model complexity and fulfillment system requirements

questions.text: What scale of merchants/traffic do you expect?
questions.impact: Determines infrastructure needs, database optimization, and scaling strategy

questions.text: Do you need an app marketplace for third-party integrations?
questions.impact: Requires API ecosystem, developer portal, app review process, and revenue sharing

metrics.business: Gross merchandise volume (GMV), take rate, merchant retention
metrics.technical: Order processing time, uptime during sales events, API response times
metrics.growth: Merchant acquisition rate, average revenue per merchant
metrics.quality: Payment success rate, cart abandonment rate, customer satisfaction

risks.mitigation: Multiple payment processors, PCI compliance, fraud detection systems
Focus on specific niche, superior developer experience, competitive pricing
Row-level security, comprehensive testing, security audits
Partner with compliance providers, legal review, automated tax calculation
Load testing, auto-scaling infrastructure, CDN optimization

successFactors: Reliable payment processing with high success rates
Intuitive merchant onboarding and management experience
Fast, responsive storefronts with excellent SEO
Comprehensive analytics and reporting for merchants
Strong app ecosystem and developer community

competitorAnalysis.Shopify: Market leader, strong ecosystem, high pricing at scale
competitorAnalysis.WooCommerce: WordPress integration, open source, technical setup required
competitorAnalysis.BigCommerce: Enterprise focus, built-in features, less customizable

differentiationOpportunities: Lower transaction fees with transparent pricing
